org.baswell.httproxy
Class ServerSocketChannelAcceptLoop

java.lang.Object
  org.baswell.httproxy.ServerSocketChannelAcceptLoop

public class ServerSocketChannelAcceptLoop
extends java.lang.Object

Accepts and dispatches incoming requests on the given ServerSocketChannel.

Constructor Summary
ServerSocketChannelAcceptLoop(NIOProxyDirector proxyDirector)
          Uses Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors() for the number of selector threads (in most circumstances this will be the best option).

Constructor Detail

ServerSocketChannelAcceptLoop

public ServerSocketChannelAcceptLoop(NIOProxyDirector proxyDirector)
Uses Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors() for the number of selector threads (in most circumstances this will be the best option).

Parameters:
proxyDirector - Must be non-null.

ServerSocketChannelAcceptLoop

public ServerSocketChannelAcceptLoop(NIOProxyDirector proxyDirector,
                                     int numSelectorThreads)
Parameters:
proxyDirector - Must be non-null.
numSelectorThreads - The number of selector threads. Requests will be evenly distributed upon each thread.
Method Detail

start

public void start(java.nio.channels.ServerSocketChannel serverSocketChannel)
           throws java.nio.channels.NotYetBoundException,
                  java.lang.SecurityException,
                  java.io.IOException
Accepts incoming non-SSL requests on serverSocketChannel and dispatches the request to one of the selector threads. This method blocks the calling thread until stop() is called by another thread or the given ServerSocketChannel is no longer bound.

Parameters:
serverSocketChannel - The channel to accept incoming client requests on. The channel must be bound before calling this method.
Throws:
java.nio.channels.NotYetBoundException - If the given ServerSocketChannel is not already bound.
java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkAccept method doesn't allow the operation.
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs when waiting for a connection.

start

public void start(java.nio.channels.ServerSocketChannel serverSocketChannel,
                  javax.net.ssl.SSLContext sslContext)
           throws java.nio.channels.NotYetBoundException,
                  java.lang.SecurityException,
                  java.io.IOException
Accepts incoming requests on serverSocketChannel and dispatches the request to one of the selector threads. This method blocks the calling thread until stop() is called by another thread or the given ServerSocketChannel is no longer bound.

Parameters:
serverSocketChannel - The channel to accept incoming client requests on. The channel must be bound before calling this method.
sslContext - If non-null incoming HTTP requests will be processed over SSL using this SSLContext. If null the incoming HTTP requests will be non-ssl.
Throws:
java.nio.channels.NotYetBoundException - If the given ServerSocketChannel is not already bound.
java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager exists and its checkAccept method doesn't allow the operation.
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs when waiting for a connection.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the accept loop. The thread blocked on start(java.nio.channels.ServerSocketChannel) will be released. No new incoming connections will be made but sockets that have already been accepted will gracefully finish up.
